availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. Saige Dury (Mount Sterling, Kentucky, attorney.)

body.p: Mount Sterling, Kentucky, commonwealth's attorney. Pennsylvania native. Editor of the Mount Sterling Whig. Attorney in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1859. Commonwealth's attorney for the Eleventh Judicial District in the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1862 to 1868.

ab.bibl: "Kentucky News," Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), March 12, 1868, p. 1. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, Mount Sterling, p. 123. John Livingston, Livingston’s United States Law Register, and Official Directory (New York: John A. Gray, 1859), p. 304. “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1862,” in 1863 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 24. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1863), 298-306. “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1863,” in 1864 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 10. (Frankfort, Ky.: Wm. E. Hughes, State Printer, 1864), 301-306. “Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1864,” in 1865 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 9-12. William T. Samuels, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865 (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, 1866), p. 10. William T. Samuels, Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts, of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1867 (Frankfort, KY: John H. Harney, 1867), p. 354. The Kentucky Sentinel (Mount Sterling, Ky.), March 5, 1868. Montgomery County Court Clerk, Wills F, 1854 to 1874, Ancestry, p. 197-201.
